IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Detailed Crash Investigation Supplement
(For review by the MSP Crash Team)



 

Section I. - Narrative

 

Vehicle 1: 2017 Honda Accord MD 7FF9612 (VIN: 1HGCR3F95HA031181)

Driver: Hashim Khalid Thomas Jr DOB: 06/01/2002 PR 1 R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center

 

Vehicle 2: 2000 Freightliner Tractor MD 976F56 (VIN: 1FUYSXYB3YLA54927)

Trailer: 2000 Charleston Marine Containers Trailer ME 5033684 (VIN: 5D7GC4027YC000312)

Driver: Desi Cornelius Davis DOB: 07/21/1973 PR 3 Ascension Saint Agnes Hospital

 

On November 29, 2023, at approximately 0453 hours, I, Trooper Ericksen #7438 responded to a vehicle collision on S/B I-95 prior to I-695. Vehicle 1 was traveling southbound on I-95 prior to I-695 when it struck the rear of the trailer being towed by vehicle 2. Vehicle 1 became disabled in lane 3. Vehicle 2 came to a controlled stop in lane 4. The driver of vehicle 1, Hashim Khalid Thomas Jr, was transported by Baltimore County Medic 5 (Run #: 233330034)to R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center with possible life-threatening injuries. The driver of vehicle 2, Desi Cornelius Davis, was transported by Baltimore County Medic 4 (Run #: 233330034) to Ascension Saint Agnes Hospital with minor injuries. The scene was marked using florescent orange paint. Vehicle 1 was towed and stored by Tauber’s Towing, 610 S. Camp Meade Rd, Linthicum Heights, MD 21090. Vehicle 2 was towed by The Auto barn Inc, 2125 W. Lafayette Ave, Baltimore, MD 21217, at the request of the company representative.

Please refer to Senior Trooper Chatfield #5628 narrative for further investigation. 

Further investigation revealed that Vehicle 2 should not have been in service due to multiple violations. The rear taillights were inoperable on the trailer of Vehicle 2. Vehicle 2 was making a lane change from lane 4 to lane 3 when it was struck by Vehicle 1.
 

As of November 29, 2023, at approximately 0707 hours, Thomas Jr was listed in stable condition. 

 

On November 29, 2023, at approximately 2353 hours, I conducted a follow-up with the nursing staff at R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Center. Nursing staff advised that Thomas Jr was listed in stable but critical condition, and intubated. His status will be monitored. 

On January 1, 2024, at approximately 0753 hours, I conducted a follow-up with Hashim Thomas Sr (Father). Thomas Sr advised that Thomas Jr is no longer intubated and had a tracheotomy procedure. Thomas Jr is currently at University of Maryland Rehabilitation & Orthopaedic Institute, 2200 Kernan Dr, Baltimore, MD 21207. 

 

All above events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.

 

Section II. - Attachments that were included in for this report:

The following items were attached to this report: 

ACRS

Vehicle Storage Report

MVA Printouts

 

Conclusion:

This case will remain open pending results of blood analysis and further investigation. A supplement will be completed for any additional investigation.

 

Trooper Ericksen #7438

Maryland State Police Golden Ring Barrack

8908 Kelso Drive Essex, MD 21221

(410) 780-2700

IncidentVehicle.VehDamageDesc: Heavy front due to vehicle collision

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
TRAINING/CERTIFICATES
 
Apprehended over 300 DUI/DWI Arrests to date.
IACP National Training Conference on Drugs, Alcohol, and Impaired Driving 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023.
DRE Instructor, November 2022.
Distinguished graduate of the University of Maryland DUI Institute 2019. 
Maryland Department of Transportation Medically Impaired Driver Detection December 2018.
Collision Reconstruction, March 2018.
SFST Instructor, February 2018.
Drug Recognition Expert, July 2017.
Maryland Department of Transportation DUI Enforcement Award, 2016, 2017, 2018.
Maryland Department of Transportation Impaired Driving Conference, October 2016.
Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (A.R.I.D.E.), September 2016.
Trained and certified to operate RADAR and LIDAR through the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, August 2016.
National Traffic Incident Management Responder Training, March 2016.
Advanced Collision Investigation, March 2016.
Trained in administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, October 2014.

On 11/29/2023 at approximately 0453 hours, Tpr Ericksen # 7438 responded to a two vehicle on southbound I-95 north of I-695. The driver of vehicle one, Hashim Khalid THOMAS Jr 06/01/2002, sustained life-threatening injuries in the collision and was transported by ambulance to R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma. I, TFC Bunger # 6459 DRE # 28902, responded to the scene at approximately 0528 hours to assist Tpr Ericksen with the collision investigation. While inspecting THOMAS' vehicle I immediately detected the odor of smoked cannabis in the interior of the vehicle. I also observed multiple cannabis products in the center console as well as cannabis smoking paraphernalia throughout the vehicle.   

After assisting Tpr Ericksen with the scene processing, I responded to Shock Trauma to check the status of THOMAS' injuries. Upon my arrival at approximately 0620 hours, THOMAS was in stable / critical condition. I also detected the odor of smoked cannabis on his person as well as his clothing. THOMAS had been intubated due to his injuries. A blood draw was conducted via implied consent. RN B Gibson performed the blood draw using blood kit R-870 at 0646 hours.

Due to the driver being transported to the hospital for medical treatment a DRE evaluation was not conducted. 

As a certified DRE, I am requesting that the blood sample be tested for CDS. I also recommend that the hospital records be subpoenaed. 

All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.
 

0646 hours

Investigative Assistance


December 6, 2023

A Search Warrant for the Honda was obtained and signed by the Honorable Judge R Cahill of the Circuit Court of Baltimore County.  The Search Warrant was executed at the Taubert's Tow lot.  The following was seized:
  • Digital Photographs
  • Electronic data from Event Data Recorder
The Event Data Recorder analysis is attached as a PDF.


December 7, 2023

The photographs were uploaded into the VeriPic Digital Evidence Management Software.


December 8, 2023

The Search Warrant was returned to the court.

 

Attachments:
  • Event Data Recorder Report
  • Analysis of Event Data Recorder
 

Status 

Additional investigation will be completed by Trooper Ericksen.
 

Investigator

Corporal J Lantz 5563
Collision Reconstruction Specialist / sUAS Pilot
State of Maryland Department of State Police

8908 Kelso Drive Essex, Maryland 21221

DETAILED NARRATIVE
 POST CRASH INSPECTION REPORT
Commercial Vehicle Enforcement Division

                                                                   

                                                 

 
                                                   

A.    CRASH SUMMARY:    

    On 11/29/2023 at approximately 0453 hours, Troopers from Golden Ring Barrack responded to a vehicle collision on I-95 in the area of I-695 on the west side (Arbutus, Baltimore County). Golden Ring requested CVED to respond. Senior Trooper Chris Chatfield #5628 of the Parkton Weight and Inspection Station responded to the scene.

    Upon, my arrival I observed that Vehicle 1, a 2017 Honda Accord bearing MD registration 7FF9612 was already towed from the scene. Vehicle 2 a 2000 Freightliner Tractor bearing MD registration 976F56 was on the right shoulder separated from a 2000 Charleston Marine Containers Trailer displaying ME 5033684. The Motor Carrier of the CMV is TREASURES SHIPPING INC (USDOT#: 2780088) of Baltimore, Maryland. The drivers, who were both transported prior to my arrival were identified as follows; The driver of vehicle 1 was, Hashim Khalid Thomas Jr DOB 6/1/2002. The driver of vehicle 2 was, Desi Cornelius Davis 07/21/1973. While on scene I made contact with Trooper Ericksen #7438 who advised he wasn't sure if the trailer lights or truck lights were on when he arrived. A review of Trooper Ericksen's body worn camera revealed that on, 11-29-23 at the 6:08 marker the lights on the truck are on. At the 6:30 mark the tail lamps to the trailer are inoperative, and the hazards lamps are flashing.  Trooper Ericksen also advised, they had trouble moving the combination out of the road way because of an issue with the brakes on the truck. Auto barn Towing arrived for the truck and was unable to tow it from the front due to the brakes locking up.  The Collison investigation is being completed by Trooper Ericksen #7438 of the Golden Ring Barrack. 


    On 11-30-23 I, Senior Trooper Chatfield responded to Auto barn's tow lot for the post crash North American Standard level 1 inspection. During the inspection the truck was hooked back up to the trailer and the tail lamps worked with a slight manipulation of the plug ends, as well as no issues were found with the brakes; see below full inspection results. 

      
B.    COMMERCIAL VEHICLE OPERATOR DETAILS


Driver Vehicle #1: 

Name: Desi Cornelius Davis
Date of Birth: 07/21/1973
Race: African American
Sex: Male    
License Number: D-120-139-122-574
State of Issuance: Maryland
License Class: C
Endorsements: None
Restrictions: None
 



Medical Certification Description:

    Davis had an expired medical examiners certificate in his possession which was also on file with the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration. The medical card was issued on 08/02/2021, and it expired on 08/02/2023. The examination was completed by Dr Andrew s. Choi (who was decertified by the National Registry on 6/26/23), Registry number 868643132. The medical card appeared to be unhampered with. Dr. Andrew Choi was decertified by the National Registry on 6/26/23.


Hours of Service Description:

    The CMV was not equipped with an ELD. Davis advised he is operating under the short haul exemption, and is therefore not required to have an ELD or paper logs in the truck. Davis said his hours are maintained at the company and that he reports there every day to work. Davis was traveling from Baltimore, MD to Laurel, MD.

Vehicle #1: 

Year: 2000
Make: Freightliner
Model: SET-BACK LONG CONVENTIONAL
VIN: 1FUYSXYB3YLA54927
Registration: 976F56
State of Issuance: Maryland

The trailer was a chassis trailer carrying an empty sea container.  See attached Photos 

Weight and Measurements:
    Weight was not requested by on scene Trooper Ericksen   

Brakes:
    Brake measurements where obtained by hooking the Truck Tractor back up to the trailer. A mechanic for Auto barn operated the service brake pedal of the truck, so I could collect measurements. Auto barn's address is 2930 James Street Baltimore, MD 21230.  

Hazardous Material:
    Was a Hazardous Material released due to the collision? (Other than fuel release from saddle/fuel tanks)
 Yes :( )   No :( X)
 

Cargo Tank:
    Was a Cargo Tank involved in this collision?
Yes :( )     No :( X)


 

 

D.        INSPECTION RESULTS: 

    The post crash inspection revealed ten pre collision defects and two post crash defects: 
 Pre Collision:

383.23A2 Operating a CMV without a CDL:
    OPERATING A CMV WITHOUT A CDL ON 11/30/2023 TRUCK GVWR IS 52,000LBS TRAILER GVWR 67,200LBS REQUIRING A CLASS "A" CDL DRIVER ONLY POSSESS A CLASS "C" LIC.


391.41A1 Operating a property-carrying vehicle without possessing a valid medical certificate- no previous history:
        EXPIRED 08-02-23

392.2RG State vehicle registration or License Plate violation:
    REGISTRATION EXPIRED 10-31-23

393.9TS Inoperative turn signal:
    LEFT FRONT TURN

393.9H Inoperable head lamps:
    RIGHT FRONT LOW BEAM

393.75A3 Tire-flat and/or audible air leak:
    2ND AXLE LEFT SIDE INNER TIRE FLAT OFF BEAD NO MEASURABLE AIR

396.5B Hubs - Wheel seal leaking - inner wheel:
3RD AXLE RIGHT SIDE WHEEL SEAL LEAKED CAUSING BRAKE FRICTION SURFACE AND DRUM TO BE CONTAMINATED WITH OIL/GREASE. (20% RULE)

393.9 Inoperable Required Lamp:
    1 OF 3 REAR ID LAMPS INOPERATIVE AND ALL CLEARANCE LAMPS INOPERATIVE

393.75A1 Tire-ply or belt material exposed:
    5TH AXLE RIGHT SIDE TIRE SIDEWALL SEPARATION PLY VISIBLE.

 Post Collision:
393.75A3 Tire-flat and/or audible air leak:
    5TH AXLE LEFT SIDE INNER TIRE FLAT NO AIR. LARGE HOLE DUE TO COLLISION.

393.207C Leaf spring assembly defective/missing:
    BETWEEN AXLE 4 AND 5 LEFT SIDE SPRING HANGER CRACKED SEPARATED AND SHIFTED AT THE CONNECTION TO FRAME. RESULT FROM COLLISION
